articles.title: EU promises to try to save Iran nuclear deal despite setback
articles.description: The European Union says it "will spare no efforts" in its attempts to keep alive an international deal preventing Iran from developing atomic weapons
articles.content:
Von der Leyen also reiterated the need to de-escalate the tension in the region, especially after Irans missile attack on two American bases in response to a U.S. strike that killed its top general.

articles.author: Glenn Kessler
articles.title: Biden’s claim that he didn’t tell Obama not to launch bin Laden raid
articles.description: The vice president's story about his advice on a pivotal moment in Obama's presidency keeps evolving.
articles.content:
FORMER VICE PRESIDENT JOE BIDEN:Well we did, and the guys name was Osama bin Laden. 
DOOCY: And didnt you tell President Obama dont go after bin Laden that day? 
BIDEN: No, I didnt. I didnt. 
exchange on Jan. 3, 2020

articles.author: Emily Schmall | AP
articles.title: Some commercial airlines reroute flights amid Mideast risks
articles.description: Some commercial airlines are rerouting flights crossing the Middle East to avoid possible danger amid escalating tensions between the United States and Iran
articles.content:
Malaysia Airlines said that due to recent events, its planes would avoid Iranian airspace.
Singapore Airlines also said that its flights to Europe would be re-routed to avoid Iran.
The U.S. Federal Aviation Administration said it was barring American pilots… [+1957 chars]

articles.title: Live updates: More than a dozen missiles hit U.S. bases in Iraq, Iran claims heavy casualties
articles.description: Trump tweeted "all is well!" but the Iranian military is claiming dozens of U.S. troops were killed.
articles.content:
Iranian forces launched more than a dozen ballistic missiles against two military bases in Iraq, the Pentagon said Tuesday evening, marking the most significant Iranian attack in the growing conflict with the United States.

articles.title: Iran strikes back at US with missile attack at bases in Iraq
articles.description: Iran has struck back at the United States for killing a top Revolutionary Guard commander, calling it revenge for the U.S. killing of Gen. Qassem Soleimani
articles.content:
A presenter on Iranian state television later claimed, without offering evidence, that the strikes killed at least 80 terrorist U.S soldiers and also damaged helicopters, drones and other equipment at the Ain al-Asad air base.
